answerText: Ivan Alekseyevich Bunin[10] Bunin considered his story "Looped Ears" to be a parody of this Dostoyevsky novel without all of the spiritual angst. In it, Raskolnikov initially justifies his murder of a pawnbroker by regarding her as a parasite on society
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Harvard  | 9 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This author wrote a story about the bloodthirsty serial killer Adam Sokolovich, who murders the prostitute Korol'kova. For 10 points each: [10] Name this Nobel laureate who wrote "Looped Ears" and a story whose title character suffers a heart attack at a hotel in Capri and has his coffin brought home on the luxury ship Atlantis, titled "The Gentleman from San Francisco."
